definition: Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter
surname Wa/sister of legendary emperor Fu Xi 伏羲
Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)

sentences.english: Nuwa not only to the day of salvation, but also in creation, work miracles.
sentences.chinese: 女娲不但补天救世，还创造万物，神通广大。

sentences.english: At this time, there is a goddess Nu Wa, in this vast wilderness walking.
sentences.chinese: 这时，有一位女神女娲，在这莽莽的原野上行走。

sentences.english: Nu Wa side cheering them for a while, slowly got separated.
sentences.chinese: 他们在女娲身旁欢呼雀跃了一阵，慢慢走散了。

sentences.english: The construction of mending the sky had not finished yet, but people did not want to wake Nuwa up.
sentences.chinese: 人们不忍心叫醒女娲，但是补天的工作还没有完成。

sentences.english: The original shape of Nüwa embodied the female characteristics of creation and sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 女娲原型集中体现了创造与牺牲统合的女性特质。

sentences.english: To save the lives of all the creatures below, Goddess Nü Wa patched the sky with stones.
sentences.chinese: 为拯救天下的生灵，女娲用大石补住了天空。

sentences.english: The second is about the Fuxi and Nuwa myth that narrates the creation of human being.
sentences.chinese: 其次是关于人类创生的女娲和伏羲神话。

sentences.english: Together with N-Wa, the women who he married with, they started the civilization of human being.
sentences.chinese: 他和女娲，他的妻子，以其开创了人类文明。

sentences.english: Historical sites concerning the origin of the legendary tale of Nü Wa are said to be in many places.
sentences.chinese: 有关女娲传说的历史遗迹分布相当广阔。

sentences.english: The Nuhuo who mended the sky in Chinese mythology?
sentences.chinese: 就是中国神话中修补天空的那个女娲呀？

sentences.english: Oh, the story of Nuhuo mending the sky took place right here.
sentences.chinese: 原来女娲补天的故事就发生在这里。

sentences.english: Nu regarded as the world put upon "God the media."
sentences.chinese: 后世人就把女娲奉为“神媒”。

sentences.english: This mother is the Nuwa of Nanzhao.
sentences.chinese: 这位母亲是南诏的女娲。

sentences.english: A fox family Nuwa was sent to lower the patron saint of stone.
sentences.chinese: 女娲座下灵狐族则被派遣下界守护神石。

sentences.english: First of all, the author introduced the Xihua County and Nv Wa city.
sentences.chinese: 首先简要介绍了西华县及女娲城。

sentences.english: Lots of people wanted to make Nuwa.

definition: Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
Daji (c. 11th century BC), concubine of the last Shang dynasty king Zhou Xin 紂辛|纣辛[Zhou4 Xin1]
Nezha, protection deity
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor, trad. 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping and writing

Jiang Ziya (c. 1100 BC, dates of birth and death unknown), partly mythical sage advisor to King Wen of Zhou 周文王[Zhou1 Wen2 wang2] and purported author of “Six Secret Strategic Teachings” 六韜|六韬[Liu4 tao1], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
Dijun, Shang dynasty protector God, possibly same as legendary Emperor 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
Lu Ban, legendary master craftsman, called the father of Chinese carpentry

Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]
Pangu (creator of the universe in Chinese mythology)
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
God of heaven/Celestial emperor
Xuan Nü, a fairy in Chinese mythology
God of Water

Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Three Sovereigns, between Gods and Emperors in third millennium BC/usually listed as Suiren 燧人[Sui4 ren2], Fuxi 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1], trapping and writing, Shennong or Farmer God 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2]
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil
